DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the hypothesis that, as compared to early intravenous feeding, early nutrition via the enteral route is associated with reduced Day 28-mortality in critically ill patients treated with mechanical ventilation and vasoactive drug.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of Early Enteral vs. Parenteral Nutrition on Mortality in Patients Requiring Mechanical Ventilation and Catecholamines
DOC.criteria: Invasive mechanical ventilation expected to be required more than 48 hours Nutrition started within 24 hours after initiation of endotracheal mechanical ventilation Treatment with vasoactive drug administered via a central venous catheter Age over 18 years Signed information Abdominal surgery within 1 month before inclusion History of esophageal, gastric, duodenal or pancreatic surgery Bleeding from the esophagus, stomach or bowel enteral nutrition via gastrostomy or jejunostomy pregnancy Treatmentlimitation decisions Current inclusion in a trial on comparison between enteral and parenteral nutrition
